```{r}
# --- 3. Loop Through Each Outcome ---
for (outcome_var in names(outcomes)) {

  outcome_label <- outcomes[outcome_var]
  log_outcome_var <- paste0(outcome_var, "_Log")

  message(paste("Processing outcome:", outcome_label, "with time variable:", time_var))

  # Log-transform the current outcome variable
  cycle_df_scaled[[log_outcome_var]] <- log(cycle_df_scaled[[outcome_var]] + 1)

  # Prepare data for the model
  selected_vars <- c(time_var, log_outcome_var, "id")
  datSX <- cycle_df_scaled[complete.cases(cycle_df_scaled[selected_vars]), ]
  datSX$id <- as.factor(datSX$id)

  # Dynamically create the formula for the GAM model
  gamm_formula <- as.formula(paste(
    log_outcome_var,
    "~ s(id, bs = 're') + s(", time_var, ", bs = 'cc', k = 10) + s(id,", time_var, ", bs = c('re','cc'), k = c(NA, 10))"
  ))
  
  # Create the knots list dynamically
  knots_list <- list(c(-1, 1))
  names(knots_list) <- time_var

  # Run the GAMM model
  gamm <- mgcv::gam(
    formula = gamm_formula,
    data = datSX,
    knots = knots_list,
    method = 'REML'
  )

  # Save the model summary to a file
  summary_filename <- paste0(gamm_directory, "gamm_", log_outcome_var, "_", time_var, "_summary_", current_date, ".txt")
  sink(summary_filename)
  print(summary(gamm))
  sink()

  # --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  # NEW: Extract GAM Summary for Both Fixed and Random Effects
  # --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  gamm_summary <- summary(gamm)
  
  # --- Part A: Average Effect (s(time_var)) ---
  avg_eff_term <- paste0("s(", time_var, ")")
  avg_eff_edf <- gamm_summary$s.table[avg_eff_term, "edf"]
  avg_eff_pval <- gamm_summary$s.table[avg_eff_term, "p-value"]
  avg_eff_stars <- case_when(
    avg_eff_pval < 0.001 ~ "***",
    avg_eff_pval < 0.01  ~ "**",
    avg_eff_pval < 0.05  ~ "*",
    TRUE               ~ ""
  )
  avg_eff_text <- paste0("Average Cycle Effect: ", round(avg_eff_edf, 2), avg_eff_stars)

  # --- Part B: Individual Differences (s(id,time_var)) ---
  ind_diff_term <- paste0("s(id,", time_var, ")")
  ind_diff_edf <- gamm_summary$s.table[ind_diff_term, "edf"]
  ind_diff_pval <- gamm_summary$s.table[ind_diff_term, "p-value"]
  ind_diff_stars <- case_when(
    ind_diff_pval < 0.001 ~ "***",
    ind_diff_pval < 0.01  ~ "**",
    ind_diff_pval < 0.05  ~ "*",
    TRUE                ~ ""
  )
  ind_diff_text <- paste0("Individual Differences in Cycle Effect: ", round(ind_diff_edf, 2), ind_diff_stars)
  
  # --- Part C: Combine for the final annotation text ---
  # We use "\n" to create a line break between the two parts
  annotation_text <- paste(avg_eff_text, ind_diff_text, sep = "\n")
  # --------------------------------------------------------------------------

  # --- Plotting ---
  
  # Create a named list for expand.grid
  grid_list <- list(seq(-1, 1, by = 0.05), id = 0)
  names(grid_list)[1] <- time_var
  plotdat <- do.call(expand.grid, grid_list)

  # Get predictions and back-transform them
  pred <- marginaleffects::predictions(
    gamm,
    newdata = plotdat,
    type = "response",
    transform = function(x) exp(x) - 1
  )

  plotdat$estimate <- pred$estimate
  plotdat$conf.low <- pred$conf.low
  plotdat$conf.high <- pred$conf.high

  # Generate the plot
  gamplot <- ggplot(plotdat, aes(x = .data[[time_var]], y = estimate)) +
    scale_x_continuous(
      limits = c(-1, 1),
      breaks = seq(-1, 1, by = 0.50),
      labels = c("Ovulation", "50%L", "Menses Onset", "50%F", "Ovulation")
    ) +
    labs(x = "", y = outcome_label) +
    geom_rect(xmin = -0.04, xmax = 0.04, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf, fill = "grey70", alpha = 0.2, color = "white") +
    geom_rect(xmin = 0.92, xmax = 1, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf, fill = "grey87", alpha = 0.2, color = "white") +
    geom_line(linewidth = 1) +
    geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = conf.low, ymax = conf.high), fill = "lightgrey", alpha = 0.3) +
    theme_minimal() +
    
    # --- UPDATED: Add the new two-line annotation ---
    annotate(
      geom = "text",
      x = -1,          # Position on the far left of the x-axis
      y = Inf,         # Position at the top of the y-axis
      label = annotation_text,
      hjust = 0,       # Left-align the text
      vjust = 1.5,     # Nudge the text down from the top (increased for two lines)
      fontface = "italic",
      size = 4         # Slightly smaller size to fit better
    )

  print(gamplot)

  # Save the plot
  plot_filename <- paste0(gamm_directory, "gamplot_", log_outcome_var, "_", time_var, "_", current_date, ".png")
  ggsave(plot_filename, gamplot, width = 8, height = 6, dpi = 500)
}
```

# --- Combined Hormone Plot for Paper ----
```{r}

# This script first generates hormone predictions from GAMM models and then
# creates a single, combined plot showing the profiles of E2, P4, and LH
# across the menstrual cycle, with specified colors and shaded clinical event windows.

# --- Part 1: Generate and Combine Hormone Model Predictions ---
# This loop processes each hormone, runs a GAMM model, corrects the scaling,
# and combines the results into a single data frame for plotting.

time_var <- "cyclic_time_ov"

hormone_vars <- c("E2_Log", "P4_Log", "LH_Log")
hormone_labels <- c("E2", "P4", "LH")
all_plotdat <- list() # A list to hold the data frames for each hormone

for (i in seq_along(hormone_vars)) {
  hormone_var <- hormone_vars[i]
  hormone_label <- hormone_labels[i]

  # Prepare data for the model
  selected_vars <- c(time_var, hormone_var, "id")
  datSX <- cycle_df_scaled[complete.cases(cycle_df_scaled[selected_vars]), ]
  datSX$id <- as.factor(datSX$id)

  # Create the formula for the GAM model
  gamm_formula <- as.formula(paste(
    hormone_var,
    "~ s(id, bs = 're') + s(", time_var, ", bs = 'cc', k = 10) + s(id,", time_var, ", bs = c('re','cc'), k = c(NA, 10))"
  ))

  # Create the knots list
  knots_list <- list(c(-1, 1))
  names(knots_list) <- time_var

  # Run the GAMM model
  gamm <- mgcv::gam(
    formula = gamm_formula,
    data = datSX,
    knots = knots_list,
    method = 'REML'
  )

  # Create grid for predictions
  grid_list <- list(seq(-1, 1, by = 0.05), id = 0)
  names(grid_list)[1] <- time_var
  plotdat <- do.call(expand.grid, grid_list)

  # Get predictions and back-transform
  pred <- marginaleffects::predictions(
    gamm,
    newdata = plotdat,
    type = "response",
    transform = function(x) exp(x) - 1
  )

  plotdat$estimate <- pred$estimate
  plotdat$conf.low <- pred$conf.low
  plotdat$conf.high <- pred$conf.high

  # --- FIX 1: Correctly sample-standardize all values ---
  # Use the mean and sd from 'estimate' to scale all three columns consistently.
  mean_est <- mean(plotdat$estimate)
  sd_est <- sd(plotdat$estimate)
  plotdat <- plotdat %>%
    mutate(
      estimate_ss = (estimate - mean_est) / sd_est,
      conf.low_ss = (conf.low - mean_est) / sd_est,
      conf.high_ss = (conf.high - mean_est) / sd_est,
      hormone = hormone_label # Add a column to identify the hormone
    )

  all_plotdat[[i]] <- plotdat
}

# Combine the list of data frames into one
combined_df <- do.call(rbind, all_plotdat)

# --- Part 2: Create and Save the Final Combined Plot ---
# This version uses the combined data frame to create the plot with a legend.

# Define the color palette for the hormones
hormone_colors <- c("E2" = "navy", "P4" = "goldenrod", "LH" = "forestgreen")

# Create the plot
combined_plot_color <- ggplot(combined_df, aes(x = .data[[time_var]], group = hormone)) +

  # --- FIX 2: Make shaded bars visible & match new labels ---
  # Menses Onset is now at x = -1 and x = 1. Ovulation is at x = 0.
  # Alpha is increased and white borders are removed for visibility.
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = -1, xmax = -0.92, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), fill = "grey70", alpha = 0.5, inherit.aes = FALSE) +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = -0.04, xmax = 0.04, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), fill = "grey87", alpha = 0.5, inherit.aes = FALSE) +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = 0.92, xmax = 1, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), fill = "grey70", alpha = 0.5, inherit.aes = FALSE) +

  # Add the hormone lines and ribbons
  geom_line(aes(y = estimate_ss, color = hormone), linewidth = 1.5) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = conf.low_ss, ymax = conf.high_ss, fill = hormone), alpha = 0.1) +

  # Define the x-axis to represent the cycle
  scale_x_continuous(
    limits = c(-1, 1),
    breaks = seq(-1, 1, by = 0.50),
    labels = c("Menses Onset", "50% Fol", "Ovulation", "50% Lut", "Menses Onset")
  ) +

  # Manually set the colors and fill to create a single, correct legend
  scale_color_manual(values = hormone_colors, name = "Hormone") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = hormone_colors, name = "Hormone") +

  # Add labels and apply theme
  labs(x = "Cycle Phase", y = "Sample-Standardized Hormone Levels") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "top") # Move legend to the top for better layout

# Save the final plot
combined_plot_color_filename <- paste0(gamm_directory, "combined_hormone_plots_color_", time_var, "_", current_date, ".png")
ggsave(combined_plot_color_filename, combined_plot_color, width = 8, height = 6, dpi = 300)
```
